title: Airfare analyst – London £40K | Buying Business Travel
text:
0 comments BBT Tue, 29 Sep 2015 12:50 Follow @BBT_online Employer type:  Recruitment agency Hours:  Full time Job category:  Business Travel Location:  Greater London Region:  England, London Salary range:  Undisclosed An excellent opportunity has arisen for a Fares expert. You will be working fast growing travel organisation based in the West End.

My client is a fast growing travel management company specialising in business and VIP travel. They are currently looking for Airfare Analysts to manage, maintain & optimize complex airfare solutions.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

As an Airfare Analyst, you will play a key decision maker in processing deals at the correct time to maximise the value and margins in each transaction.

We have 4 vacant positions for highly experienced airfare analysts.
The main responsibilities of this role include:

*Efficiently handling Requests for Quotation (RFQs), fare calculation and general fare construction, including manual fare builds.
*Pricing management within our Global Distribution ( GDS ) IT system, including the maintenance of the rate databases.
*Expert analysis on RFQs and fares, and ongoing trends within this data, and the production of detailed reports for senior management.
*Reviewing feedback from clients on rate competitiveness and making recommendations accordingly.
*Processing revalidations, reissues, refunds and miscellaneous charges orders where relevant.
*Multiple purpose document calculation and management.
*Providing support to the sales team and assisting with the training of junior staff.

EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

You will possess extensive experience as a fare analyst within the passenger transport industry or working with airfares and pricing. You will possess detailed knowledge of international fares. Due to the specialised nature of the role, we would expect you to have passed a level 2 IATA course in air fares and ticketing, or have equivalent commercial experience.

You will have an in-depth knowledge of at least one of the four major GDS systems (Amadeus, Worldspan, Galileo & Sabre), as well as an understanding of Billing and Settlement Plan ( BSP ) and Airlines Reporting Corporation (ARC) protocols and requirements. You will be able to perform well under pressure.
You will possess the ability to identify problems and resolve them in a timely and efficient manner, as well as being able to recognise trends and associations within airfare data. Lastly, you will have good verbal and written communication skills.
